links.title: Sulfhemoglobinemia - Wikipedia
links.description: Sulfhemoglobinemia is a rare condition in which there is excess sulfhemoglobin (SulfHb) in the blood. The pigment is a greenish derivative of hemoglobin which cannot be converted back to normal, functional hemoglobin. It causes cyanosis even at low blood levels.

Today it is a subsidiary of Nestlé and sold in the United States.[1] The spring was first exploited commercially in 1859 by Hiram Ricker, owner of a nearby inn.[2][citation needed] Contemporary demand is so great the brand’s water is derived from multiple sources in the state of Maine in...

links.title: Purely functional scene graphs

In this paper, we present a simple yet powerful Domain Specific Language
for working with three-dimensional scene data.

domain model with functionality for rendering and interaction.
